page.title: 06Tree climbing
page.content: When I go{tree climbing}I pick a tree which is not too hard and not too easy.Then I{plan out a route}before starting to climb it.In this planning I try to think out where my first step will be.This will hopefully bring me on or near the first branch,but if I cannot reach it then I take a jump for it and try to pull myself up. When I'm clinging on to the branch I get my legs wrapped around it,pulling myself up to reach for another branch.Then I stand up on the lower branch.If a further branch is within reach I go on climbing upwards,if not I have to give up. The thoughts that run through my head are "Hope I don't slip and fall!" "Look how high I am!" and "How will I get down?!" When I do get down I feel safe again. JOHN LAMPREY
